intro: Metteniusa cogolloi, commonly known as the Cogollo’s metteniusa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
